channel.title: Rust on Daniel Correia
channel.description: Recent content in Rust on Daniel Correia

item.title: Ownership and Borrowing in Rust
item.description: Ownership and Borrowing in Rust Ownership The Book1 states the following as the three rules of ownership in Rust: Each value in Rust has an owner. There can only be one owner at a time. When the owner goes out of scope, the value will be dropped. Going out of scope essentially means coming to the end of the trailing curly brace ‘}’ of the one in which a value was introduced in.
